issue.title: Add support for background blur
issue.body:
Add new `background_blur` boolean configuration option for enabling background
blur effect.

This setting currently only has any effect when Alacritty is used with KWin and
X11 as the implementation relies on KWin's compositor for blurring.

This feature was requested in #972 

Considering the limited OS/WM support, I realize that you might not want to introduce this feature as-is. However, I still decide to open this PR as a sort of proof-of-concept implementation that works well enough for me. Maybe someone else will also find it useful.

![Screenshot_20200330_192224](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40366/77937214-b0920880-72bc-11ea-8dd1-3f5cdf1f476f.png)

body: A side note: Comptons blur used to be quite expensive on the CPU side IIRC, so that is not really a viable option for mobile users. Also, compton != linux, there is a growing crowd of people using Wayland. As such, I as well would like this to be a capability of the terminal. Alacritty already uses the GPU for rendering, hence it might be easier to leverage shaders for the blur as well to get an useful yet efficient blur implementation.

>Alacritty already uses the GPU for rendering, hence it might be easier to leverage shaders for the blur as well to get an useful yet efficient blur implementation.

This is not how it works, alacritty can't possibly do blur because it doesn't know about contents you have on screen. That being said, blur is done by system's compositor on all display servers  I'm aware of. The only thing that alacritty can do is ask for blur your system's compositor, and hope that it blurs things.

@kchibisov This is not 100% true, technically. There are ways to get some part of the screen buffer, and blur that. Similar as to how a magnifier application or a screenshot tool work. IIRC URxvt supports blur through that as well. It is quite ugly though, because the blur is not updated when the URxvt window moves. My hope would be that this can be improved a lot if the blur is done on the GPU. But an implementation in the compositor definitely is cleaner and can perform way better.

You can make blur, by making screen shot of the entire screen, sure, but you can't make it work cross platform that way. Also, this is the most stupid way to make blur you can imagine, and I only saw that on X11.

Found a hack for KDE blur! Not too sure about the implementation itself, but found it [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/kde/comments/6jzuwu/konsole_and_yakuake_blur/djilli2/) and tweaked it for Alacritty. 
Right when I was about to switch from this beautiful terminal! 
Add the following to your .zsh or .bash config, make sure you have xdotool and voila! 
```
if [[ $(ps --no-header -p $PPID -o comm) =~ '^alacritty$' ]]; then
        for wid in $(xdotool search --pid $PPID); do
            xprop -f _KDE_NET_WM_BLUR_BEHIND_REGION 32c -set _KDE_NET_WM_BLUR_BEHIND_REGION 0 -id $wid; done
fi
```
